bibl.title: James Robinson v. Territory of Washington. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case files, 1860-1889

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla } s.s.
To the Hon. the Judge of the District Court First Judicial District.

James Robinson would respectfully represent to your Honor that he is a person in what is called the Lock Up House & jail of the city of Walla Walla & restrained of his liberty upon him &c restrained of his liberty & since last Sunday morning the 15th day of June A.D. 1862 & by the sheriff of the said county of Walla Walla James Buckley & is or restrained as aforementioned upon the pretence & suspicion that he has been guilty of horse stealing as this affiant understand & believes, & this affiant here declares & petitions his innocence of any crime unlawfully of that with which he is accused & affiant has repeatedly asked to know what he is charged with, & has also frequently demanded a hearing & that he may confronted with the witnesses, & evdence against him if any such the has been refused him
& then affiant knows of no legal process by which he is confined & restrained in the place aforesaid or & knows of no judgement against him & verily believes he is not confined as aforesaid upon some indictment or petition of any court sentence & this affiant prays for a writ of Habeas Corpus to be offered in clear form offered & such he prays he released from the restraintment.
Subcribed and sworn to before me this 19th day of June, A.D. 1862.
In the matter of James Robinson jail Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Territory of Washtington ey. relatione James Robinson Habeas Corpus. And now to writ fued 19 7/62 Writ allowed Hearing June 20th 1862 at 10 OC A.M. as Clerk aforee in the city of Walla Walla by
div1.ab: E. P. Oliphant Hon. Jus. S.C. N. S. W.T.
